September 2019

of the Justia client newsletter!

Get the latest scoop on online marketing, read our digest of legal and SEO news from the past month, and peek inside the doors at Justia to see what our team has been doing.

Tip of the Month

Make Your Attorney Profile Page More Robust

Did you know the highest-trafficked page on your law firm site besides your home page is likely your attorney profile page? Many attorneys leave this page bare bones and neglect to include vital and compelling information that can build confidence with clients and prospective clients. Even if you lack years of legal experience, there are plenty of subjects to cover and ways to differentiate yourself. Read more about the importance of this page and what to include.
Learn How

Tech News

Judge Orders Georgia to Switch to Paper Ballots for 2020 Elections

After identifying significant security problems with the state’s current election technology, a federal judge has ordered Georgia to stop using its outdated touch screen voting system.

State Attorneys General Said to Be Near Formal Investigation of Tech Companies

A bipartisan group of state attorneys general is reported to be on the verge of issuing antitrust civil investigative demands to Facebook, Google, Amazon, and Apple.

Legal Shield for Websites Rattles Under Onslaught of Hate Speech

A 1996 law has helped today’s tech giants thrive by protecting them from liability for user-created content, but the proliferation of online hate speech may change that.

Police Can Get Your Ring Doorbell Footage Without a Warrant, Report Says

New reports indicate that police departments around the country work with Amazon-owned home surveillance company Ring to request and obtain user footage.

Pai’s FCC Orders Cities and Towns to Stop Regulating Cable and Broadband

A new FCC order states that local governments may not regulate broadband offered over a cable system, prompting speculation that the agency’s decision will face legal challenges.

22 Texas Towns Hit by Coordinated Ransomware Attack

Various departments within 22 small towns in Texas have been hit by a ransomware campaign from a single source, and both federal and state investigations are underway.

Featured Site of the Month

Injury Law Center

in Nashua, NH, recently launched 
their Justia website:

injury-law-center.com

SEO News

Finding Fresh, Helpful Information Through Featured Snippets

A new Google algorithm update helps users find more pertinent information by distinguishing and prioritizing recent content in its featured snippets when timeliness matters.

Review Counts Matter More to Local Business Revenue Than Star Ratings, According to Study

A study examining over 200,000 U.S. small businesses in various industries found that a company’s number of online reviews was more important for revenue than average ratings.

New Research Shows Strong Link Between Google My Business Photo Quantity and Search Performance

A recent analysis shows a high correlation between the number of images on a Google My Business Listing and how many clicks, calls, direction requests the listing generates.

Are Google Mobile Searches Now 65% Of All Searches?

Unconfirmed reports indicate that mobile searches now constitute 65% of all searches, up from over 50% in 2015.

How to Get a Customer to Edit Their Negative Review

A new study has yielded some surprising insights regarding the way consumers relate to online business reviews, and what you can do to remedy a negative one.

Prepare to Say Goodbye to Average Position in Google Ads on September 30

At the end of this month, Google will begin winding down the average position metric in Google Ads, meaning that users must update any related reporting, rules, or scripts.

Internet Stats

Mobile User Experience

Justia builds branded Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) that provide a faster user experience since they're lightweight, optimized for mobile downloads, and preloaded to a user's mobile browser when they're on a Google search results page.

Source: Think with Google

Did You Know?

We Recently Updated Our Brand Page

You may find the guidelines to use the Justia logo, icon, colors, typography, and the lawyer rating badge on our brand page. If you have obtained a Justia Lawyer Rating, login and go to “Your Justia Rating Badge” when editing your profile, to find usage details. Tips for utilizing the badge are linked from our brand page as well.

Social Media News

In Strategy Shift, Facebook Seeks to Pay Millions to License News

Facebook has reportedly approached a number of prominent news outlets with a proposal to license their content on its platform in a new initiative that could begin as early as this year.

Amazon’s Twitter Ambassadors Are Blurring the Line Between Fact and Fiction

Amazon has come under scrutiny once again for utilizing Twitter ambassadors in an apparent effort to improve public perception of the working conditions at its fulfillment centers.

YouTube Sues Alleged Copyright Troll Over Extortion of Multiple YouTubers

YouTube has accused an individual of utilizing false copyright strikes to extort money from numerous YouTube creators, and has brought suit under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act.

Facebook Rolls Out Tool to Block Off-Facebook Data Tracking

In an apparent effort to preempt regulation in the U.S. and abroad, Facebook is testing a new tool that will limit how the social media platform can track user behavior outside of Facebook.

Legal Industry News

Jobs in Legal Services Sector Increase For Third Straight Month

Continuing a general upward trend that began in December, the legal industry posted a slight gain in July that represented an increase of 2,400 jobs since a year ago at this time.

‘Caste System’ at Some Law Firms Won’t Survive, Consultant Says; Multidisciplinary Teams Will

According to an industry insider, law firms may soon face economic pressure to employ multidisciplinary teams of lawyers and non-lawyers instead of a hierarchical mentality.

The Most Effective Tech Tools for Lawyers? New Survey Says They Ain’t What You Think

Though Blockchain and AI have garnered much attention, new data show that the most important tech tools for lawyers relate to document management, billing, and time keeping.

ABA Has Seen Improvement in Key Areas After Launch of New Membership Model, Executive Director Says

In the wake of changes such as introducing a new dues structure, a new CLE Marketplace, and an ABA Career Center, the organization reports strong performance in important areas.
